creator: robertsearle@hotmail.com
text:
The rpm when download and installed on linux RedHat 7.2 will have the 
sever.xml file pointing to port 8180 instead of 8080.  I spent a lot of time 
trying to figure this one out.  It seems to work fine, i.e. I get the 
index.html file now.  

If you are able to confirm this, would you please respond to John Niven mail 
with the Subject: RE: tomcat waiting in linux  and tell him that he is right.

All the ports (http, ajp12, ajp13, https) are modified to allow
you to have at the same time Tomcat 3.3 and 4.x.

It's explained in /usr/doc/tomcat-4.0.2/TOMCAT4.README.RPM

text:
I agree, but the RPM case is special since you could
have at the same time a TOMCAT 3.3 and TOMCAT 4.0 RPM
installed.

To avoid conflict problem in listen(), the TC 4.0 RPM
changed all the listen ports.

It's explained in TOMCAT4.README.RPM.
